stories.title: Thoughts on Lex Fridman's Interview with Pfizer CEO

stories.text:
Presume the internet as it exists isn't what we hoped for and you are put on some committee of magicians. You are tasked with waving a wand over the internet and miraculously fixing things through sheer magic.

What would you keep?

What would you throw away?

What would you bring back?

What would you like to see more of?

What were you hoping the internet would solve but hasn't?

What real world things has the internet replaced that you would like to have back?

What real world things would you like to see cyber-ized?

Are you generally optimistic or pessimistic about the future of the internet?

(Disclosure: I just think this is an interesting topic. There is no business, product, or ulterior motive behind these questions)
stories.title: Ask HN: How would you fix the web?
What is Web3 and why is Jack Dorsey attacking the 'next phase of the internet'?

stories.text: There was recently this thread "Ask HN: Those making $500/month on side projects in 2021 – Show and tell". What about those of you with side projects that don't have the profit motive in mind? Do you operate anything on the side that is purely for art, or education, or some other type of interesting work? Why do you do it? Who is the audience? Any interesting stories?
stories.title: Ask HN: Those with intentionally non-remunerative side projects – Show and tell
